column2: NEW HAMPSHIRE DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: New Hampshire
column6: NH

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Drivers should always signal when:
column4: pulling into traffic from a parking area or alley.
column6: changing lanes.
column8: pulling out of a parking space.

column2: 2. When the pavement is marked with a double yellow line, drivers may pass other vehicles:
column4: None of the other answers is correct.
column6: only if the vehicle ahead is driving 10 mph or more under the speed limit.
column8: only if there are no oncoming vehicles.

column2: 3. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: once you have moved into the exit lane.
column6: once you see the toll booth.
column8: before moving into the exit lane.
column10: when you first see the exit sign.

column2: 4. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column6: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.
column8: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.

column2: 5. When you drive near parks and playgrounds, you should expect children:
column4: not to cross unless they are with an adult.
column6: to suddenly run into the street.
column8: to stop at the curb before crossing the street.
column10: to know when it is safe to cross.

column2: 6. The yield sign means:
column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column8: You must come to a complete stop.
column10: The traffic light will soon be red.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: 4-way stop
column6: You must turn right
column8: Railroad crossing

column2: 8. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look into the left side mirror.
column6: look into the right side mirror.
column8: look into the rearview mirror.
column10: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.

column2: 9. Distracted driving:
column4: causes the driver to react more slowly to hazards.
column6: usually causes the driver to drive slower.
column8: is only dangerous for inexperienced drivers.

column2: 10. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column6: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column8: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column10: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 11. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column4: yellow warning lights.
column6: red lights.
column8: green lights.

column2: 12. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column6: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column8: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column10: tap the gas pedal with their foot.

column2: 13. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column6: keep less space in front of their vehicle.
column8: reduce the minimum following distance.
column10: keep more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 14. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.
column6: They give directional information.
column8: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.

column2: 15. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column6: you are not allowed to park here.
column8: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column10: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 16. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must change lane immediately.
column6: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 17. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column6: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
column8: turn off your engine.

column2: 18. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column6: share the lane with another vehicle.
column8: race on empty roads.
column10: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 19. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column6: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column8: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column10: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.

column2: 20. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Danger ahead.
column6: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.
column8: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 21. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column4: Never use
column6: It is not recommended to check
column8: Never depend on

column2: 22. Night driving can be more difficult because:
column4: vehicle operators tend to drive faster at night.
column6: the ratio of motorcyles to cars is much higher at night.
column8: speed limits do not apply at night.

column2: 23. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column6: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column8: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 24. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column4: A cold remedy.
column6: Tranquilizers.
column8: Marijuana.

column2: 25. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: the lane to the left may pass.
column6: passing is not permitted in either direction.
column8: passing is permitted in either direction.
column10: the lane to the right may pass.

column2: 26. A yellow arrow used to control turns from a specific traffic lane:
column4: is never used as a traffic signal.
column6: is warning the traffic a green arrow is about to be shown.
column8: means that you may go in the direction indicated by the arrow.
column10: means the same as a circular yellow light for the lane of traffic indicated by the arrow.

column2: 27. Drivers should always look carefully for motorcycles before changing lanes because:
column4: motorcycles always have the right-of-way at intersections.
column6: motorcycles are smaller and harder to see.
column8: motorcycles are not permitted to share traffic lanes.

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column4: Mountain trail
column6: School crossing
column8: Flagger ahead

column2: 29. What should you do when another car is trying to pass you?
column4: speed up.
column6: yield the right-of-way to the other driver.
column8: pull off the road to allow safe passing.
column10: After checking for oncoming traffic, adjust your speed to allow safe passing.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column4: Turn right or left
column6: Traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow
column8: No right turn

column2: 31. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Not drinking over a period of time.
column6: Eating before or while you drink.
column8: Drinking coffee.

column2: 32. When passing you should NOT:
column4: signal left to let others know that you will be pulling out.
column6: look in your rearview mirrors and glance over your shoulder before pulling out to pass.
column8: go far enough past the vehicle you are passing so that you can see the vehicle in your inside rearview mirror.
column10: leave less than 4 feet of space between your vehicle and the vehicle you are passing.

column2: 33. Defensive driving is a driving technique in which you as a driver:
column4: identify dangerous driving situations and take action to avoid an accident.
column6: defend against poor drivers by getting ahead of them in traffic.
column8: defend yourself against accidents by following close to the vehicle ahead.
column10: defend against accidents by driving your vehicle fast enough to stay ahead of traffic congestion.

column2: 34. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column4: yield to all trains at the crossing.
column6: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.
column8: always stop.
column10: speed up to beat the train.

column2: 35. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as a green light.
column6: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column8: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 36. Because many crashes happen when a vehicle is turning left, drivers should:
column4: move into the left lane of a multilane road.
column6: yield to oncoming vehicles, bicyclists and pedestrians.
column8: slow down gradually while checking the rear view mirror.

column2: 37. When you are involved in an accident and your vehicle is blocking traffic, you should:
column4: wait for the police to arrive before moving your vehicle.
column6: move your vehicle off of the travelled portion of the roadway, if possible.
column8: not move your vehicle under any circumstances.

column2: 38. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column6: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.
column8: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.

column2: 39. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: go to the next entrance ramp.

column2: 40. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Train intersection
column6: Low ground clearance railroad crossing
column8: Parallel railroad crossing (crossroad)
